conbody.note: If you are installing a single-host deployment, skip this section.
conbody.p: resource pool hosts run the application services scheduled for the resource pool to which they belong, and for which they have sufficent RAM and CPU resources.
has two broad categories of application services: Infrastructure and collection. The services associated with each category can run in the same resource pool, or can run in separate resource pools.

For improved reliability, two resource pool hosts are configured as nodes in an Apache ZooKeeper ensemble. The storage required for ensemble hosts is slightly different than the storage required for all other resource pool hosts: Each ensemble host requires a separate primary partition for internal services data, in addition to the primary partition for Docker data. Unless the ZooKeeper service on the master host fails, their roles in the ZooKeeper ensemble do not affect their roles as resource pool hosts.
conbody.note: The hosts for the ZooKeeper ensemble require static IP addresses, because ZooKeeper does not support hostnames in its configurations.
conbody.p: Repeat the procedures in the following sections for each host you wish to add to your deployment.
